comments.body:
176 resources with multiple parents.

[multiple-parents.csv](https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/files/7567503/multiple-parents.csv)

@eliotjordan do you have the code used to generate this report? I think we'll need to flesh it out more, maybe add links to the resource and to both parents, maybe also titles and collections or ephemera projects each item belongs to. We should probably talk to @kelea99 about who might help us look through this and what fields that person will need. Not a terrifying number of records though! üéâ

Happily, @eliotjordan and @hackartisan ! opening .csv now. If we could get a dump with a bit more info, that would be super helpful for me. Let me have a look at some of the items to get a better idea what fields will be useful to pull.
Doing a sample search of the CSV - all of these are leading to Box 67 (LAE) and Box 71 (LAE) so far. are they just two funky boxes?

That's interesting. I actually didn't expect ephemera folders. Expected scanned resources and geo resources. I wonder if we have another bug. There is a field in the ephemera folder form that allows you to change the box. We should look into that.
They are also all (so far) the PUDL0025 migration (have a look at the local identifier) and all posters.
The posters were all handled separately, wernt they?  Id probably start there (knowing nothing)

@tpendragon The other 3 properties were all using the AutoIncrementValidator, so they don't need the BetterParamsInteger. I added a comment referencing our discussion yesterday, about the possibility of using a validator for the coin_number. But I don't think we need any further code changes. Please take a look when you get a chance! Assuming it's ready, when should we run the migration?
@hackartisan Whenever should be fine. Maybe kick it off some time today if we get this deployed?

The merged PR had to be reverted; I pushed the 4728-coin-accession branch again so we can work more on this.

Error observed on staging after deploy prevented the migration from running. A replication of the error: 
```
irb(main):013:0> r = query_service.find_all_of_model(model: Numismatics::Coin).last
Traceback (most recent call last):
        6: from (irb):13
        5: from (irb):13:in `rescue in irb_binding'
        4: from app/adapters/instrumented_adapter.rb:141:in `find_all_of_model'
        3: from app/adapters/instrumented_adapter.rb:44:in `trace'
        2: from app/adapters/instrumented_adapter.rb:48:in `block in trace'
        1: from app/adapters/instrumented_adapter.rb:143:in `block in find_all_of_model'
Dry::Struct::Error ([Numismatics::Coin.new] [] (Array) has invalid type for :find_number violates constraints (can't convert Array into Integer failed))
```

figgy.title: Get collection resources from figx, support Ephemera Projects

comments.body: Split into several other PRs.

figgy.title: Search for Lapidus_11426331-02 gives "The requested resource does not exist" flash

comments.body:
I checked the JSON to see what could be erroring: https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog.json?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=Lapidus_11426331-02

There were two results -  the second one had an ID that's not in postgres. ID: `76364993-48d3-40b7-91eb-3c13d88a4427`

I searched the logs, and it looks like this corresponds to https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/53391/faults/82636440.

In the logs that corresponds to this error:

```
Task queue processing has stalled for 20001 ms with 0 remaining elements to process.
```

We saw this in reindexing.

I think what's happening is Solr's taking 20 seconds (which is NUTS!) to commit some big record combos. The indexing adapter sees this error and rolls back, with the assumption that solr's errored so it didn't get the record persisted. Unfortunately, Solr's throwing this error but -still indexing.-

I'm marking this sudden priority. If we can't fix this we might have to go back to solr 7.

The stallTime error is new in Solr 8.4.
I'm hoping https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/pull/2575 will fix this. I've deployed it, and I'll resolve the relevant honeybadger errors and we can keep an eye on it.
I deleted the one bad solr record, I'm going to see about doing a quick check for some bad solr records which would come up in searches.

Step 1: Get all IDs in Solr created in the last three days:
```ruby
doc_ids = Valkyrie::MetadataAdapter.find(:index_solr).connection.get("select", params: { q: "!(internal_resource_ssim:FileSet)", fq: "created_at_dtsi:[#{3.days.ago.iso8601} TO NOW]", fl: "id", rows: 200000})["response"]["docs"].map{|x| x["id"]}
```

Step 2: Find all of them which don't have a postgres equivalent

```ruby
postgres_ids = ChangeSetPersister.default.query_service.custom_queries.find_saved_ids(ids: doc_ids).map{|x| x.to_s}
bad_ids = doc_ids.reject{|id| postgres_ids.include?(id)}
```

This returned 1,298 bad records.

```ruby
Valkyrie::MetadataAdapter.find(:index_solr).connection.delete_by_id(bad_ids)
```
That's been run in production - closing this ticket.

lockers_and_study_spaces.title: Export old data from the last two years

comments.body:
Updated query to get lat two years and any application that is assigned, but not expired.
```
SELECT Applicant.*, Status.status as statusAtApplication, Location.location as preferredGeneralArea, Department.deptTitle as departmentAtApplication, Semester.semester, Spaces.space, Spaces.location, SpaceType.type FROM [Applicant] 
join Status on Applicant.status = Status.id 
join Location on Applicant.locationPreference = Location.id 
join Department on Applicant.deptID = Department.deptId 
join Semester on Applicant.occupancySemester = Semester.id 
left join Spaces on Applicant.spaceAssigned = Spaces.spaceId
join SpaceType on Applicant.spaceTypePreference = SpaceType.id
where date_of_application > '20190101' or (releaseDate is null and assignedDate is not null and expirationDate > CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)
```

princeton_ansible.title: Configure stall time to be very high.
adds encrypted private key for vireo prod site

comments.body:
Two notes:
1. I don't think the Confluence role configures tomcat/catalina options now. At least, I don't see a file or a template for `setenv.sh` anywhere, and searching the repo for `xmx` doesn't turn up anything in the confluence role.
2. It would be great to express `Xms` and `Xmx` in the same units - either `1024m` and `4096m` or `1g` and `4g`.

Confluence is currently running Java 11.0.12 and Tomcat 9. Both are embedded - Tomcat is in /opt/atlassian/confluence/bin/ and Java is in /opt/atlassian/confluence/jre/bin/. 

For ease of maintenance, it would be better to run Confluence on a standard install of Java and Tomcat. Let's try this in staging and see how stable it is.
